channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-54] Starting FuseESB on Windows XP reports log4j error on the console
item.description:
I started Fuse ESB -37 release on my Windows XP 32bit and after a little while the console reported

 
 
 
 
FuseESB:karaf@root> log4j:ERROR A "org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender" object is not assignable to a "org.apache.log4j
 
.Appender" variable.
 
log4j:ERROR The class "org.apache.log4j.Appender" was loaded by
 
log4j:ERROR [org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl@16db810] whereas object of type
 
log4j:ERROR "org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender" was loaded by [org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl@9ac0f5].
 
log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate appender named "out".
 
log4j:ERROR A "org.apache.log4j.OsgiThrowableRenderer" object is not assignable to a "org.apache.log4j.spi.ThrowableRend
 
erer" variable.
 
log4j:ERROR The class "org.apache.log4j.spi.ThrowableRenderer" was loaded by
 
log4j:ERROR [org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl@16db810] whereas object of type
 
log4j:ERROR "org.apache.log4j.OsgiThrowableRenderer" was loaded by [org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl@9ac0f5].
 
 
 
log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate throwableRenderer.
 
 

I have not touched any files. Just started Fuse ESB using
bin\fuseesb.bat

And I use a JDK 1.6 release.
item.summary: Starting FuseESB on Windows XP reports log4j error on the console

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
My karaf info

FuseESB:karaf@root> info
 
Karaf
 
  Karaf version               2.2.5.fuse-7-037
 
  Karaf home                  E:\fuse-esb-7.0.0.fuse-037
 
  Karaf base                  E:\fuse-esb-7.0.0.fuse-037
 
  OSGi Framework              org.apache.felix.framework - 4.0.3.fuse-7-037
 
 
 
JVM
 
  Java Virtual Machine        Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM version 16.0-b13
 
  Version                     1.6.0_18
 
  Vendor                      Sun Microsystems Inc.
 
  Uptime                      4 minutes
 
  Total compile time          16.717 seconds
 
Threads
 
  Live threads                55
 
  Daemon threads              39
 
  Peak                        278
 
  Total started               281
 
Memory
 
  Current heap size           49,366 kbytes
 
  Maximum heap size           506,816 kbytes
 
  Committed heap size         127,424 kbytes
 
  Pending objects             0
 
  Garbage collector           Name = 'Copy', Collections = 52, Time = 0.519 seconds
 
  Garbage collector           Name = 'MarkSweepCompact', Collections = 4, Time = 0.569 seconds
 
Classes
 
  Current classes loaded      6,014
 
  Total classes loaded        6,014
 
  Total classes unloaded      0
 
Operating system
 
  Name                        Windows XP version 5.1
 
  Architecture                x86
 
  Processors                  1
Got this on win 2008 64 bit as well.

I reproduced it again. I stopped Fuse ESB. Deleted the data, instances, and the lock file. And started Fuse ESB again.
Same error.

After 5 sec or so the console shows that error.
I cannot find anything odd in the log about this log4j issue
I see the same thing on Windows 7 x64

That was supposed to be fixed, but I guess my fix wasn't sufficient somehow.
I think the problem comes from a synchronization issue between the internal log4j and the configadmin configuration inside paxlogging.
I'll try to have another look.
After I have installed some Camel applications, and restarted my Fuse ESB some times. I have not seen this error since.

However I just stopped the Fuse ESB server. Deleted the data/instance directories and the lock file.
I started Fuse ESB again. And the error appears again on the console.

It may be related to 1st time startup, where the data directory is empty.

I just did 2 starts of the Fuse ESB, and the error was only the 1st time, see

 
 
 
 
E:\fuse-esb-7.0.0.fuse-037>bin\fuseesb.bat
 
Please wait while Fuse ESB is loading...
 
______                   _____  _____ ______

\_|   \__,_||___/ \___| \____/ \____/ \____/
 
 
 
  Fuse ESB (7.0.0.fuse-037)
 
  http://fusesource.org/esb/
 
 
 
Hit '<tab>' for a list of available commands
 
and '[cmd] --help' for help on a specific command.
 
Hit '<ctrl-d>' or 'osgi:shutdown' to shutdown Fuse ESB.
 
 
 
FuseESB:karaf@root> log4j:ERROR A "org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender" object is not assignable to a "org.apache.log4j
 
.Appender" variable.
 
log4j:ERROR The class "org.apache.log4j.Appender" was loaded by
 
log4j:ERROR [org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl@1a88254] whereas object of type
 
log4j:ERROR "org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender" was loaded by [org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl@1779885].
 
log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate appender named "out".
 
log4j:ERROR A "org.apache.log4j.OsgiThrowableRenderer" object is not assignable to a "org.apache.log4j.spi.ThrowableRend
 
erer" variable.

log4j:ERROR "org.apache.log4j.OsgiThrowableRenderer" was loaded by [org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl@1779885]
 
.
 
log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate throwableRenderer.

E:\fuse-esb-7.0.0.fuse-037>bin\fuseesb.bat
 
Please wait while Fuse ESB is loading...
 
______                   _____  _____ ______

and '[cmd] --help' for help on a specific command.

FuseESB:karaf@root>
Just wondering if you looked into this Guillaume?
At least I still see this in #40 - not sure about current 7.0-SNAPSHOT. Installing camel-jpa feature seems to reproduce it on Linux.
Don't see this any more in build 51. Tested on Windows 2008 64bit
